intro: Cyphostemma ouakense, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
